casebody.data:
Robert C. Turner, Appellant v. Jacob Silberman, Respondent. Decided June 23, 1887. Appeal from judgment dis missing complaint. Hyland & Zabriskie, for appellant. Stern & Myers for respondent.

Before Freedman and Truax, JJ.

Per Curiam.

The reasons assigned by the learned Chief Judge for dismissing plaintiff’s complaint at the trial, are well founded. The judgment should be affirmed with costs.
